document.masterDocTitle: New species of Nannoniscidae (Crustacea, Isopoda) and Saetoniscus n. gen. from the deep sea of the Angola Basin

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Nannoniscidae (Crustacea, Isopoda) and Saetoniscus n. gen. from the deep sea of the Angola Basin

subSubSection.paragraph: Type locality: Angola Basin, Atlantic 5389 m .
Distribution: only known from type locality.
Etymology: named for the many long sensory setae on ventral side of pereopod 1 propodus.
A 2 broken off in holotype , not illustrated.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14 :
Rapaniscus multisetosus
n. sp. , holotype female of 3.8 mm length in lateral view, antennule, left mandible, right mandible, maxillula, maxilla, maxilliped.

FIGURE 15 :
Rapaniscus multisetosus
n. sp. , holotype female of 3.8 mm length, pereopods 1, 2, 6.

FIGURE 16 :
Rapaniscus multisetosus
n. sp. , holotype female of 3.8 mm length, pereopods 5, 7, pleopods 2­5, uropod.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks

Rapaniscus
Siebenaller & Hessler, 1981
is characterised by dorsomedially fused pereonites 6 and 7 , a 5 ­segmented antennule with a swollen last article, a massive pereopod 1 with a broad carpus, bearing long, robust setae, and a female with a large recurved ventral spine on operculum. These characters are present in
R. multisetosus
n. sp. as well, however, the carpus of pereopod 1 of the new species bears a row of much stronger and longer sensory setae than in
R. dewdneyi
Siebenaller & Hessler, 1981
, or
R. crassipes
Siebenaller & Hessler, 1981
. The propodus of pereopod 1 of
R. multisetosus
is also much shorter, only half as long as carpus.
